# Azure Update Center
*Version 1.0 BETA (04/2022) - Made by* [***JDMSFT***](https://github.com/jdmsft)

This workbook is intended to give an overview of your Azure IaaS services updates which leverage [**Automatic VM Guest Patching**](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/automatic-vm-guest-patching) and [**Azure Update Management**](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/automation/update-management) features.

Use the global filter below to properly define the global data context of this workbook.

parameters.name: UpdatesWorkspacesGlobal
parameters.label: Updates Workspaces (Global)
parameters.query:
resources
| where ['type'] == "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions" and name contains "Updates("
| extend workspaceId = tostring(properties.workspaceResourceId)
| summarize by workspaceId, tenantId, subscriptionId

content.json:
## Azure Virtual Machines

If **Automatic VM Guest Patching** is enabled on a VM, then the available **Critical** and **Security** patches are downloaded and applied automatically on the VM. This process kicks off automatically every month when new patches are released. Patch assessment and installation are automatic, and the process includes rebooting the VM as required. Patches are installed within 30 days of the monthly patch releases. More details about **Automatic VM Guest Patching** [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/automatic-vm-guest-patching).

content.query:
resources
| where type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines' and properties.storageProfile.osDisk.osType == 'Linux'
| extend AutomaticUpdates = properties.osProfile.linuxConfiguration.enableAutomaticUpdates
| extend PatchMode = properties.osProfile.linuxConfiguration.patchSettings.patchMode
| extend AssessmentMode = properties.osProfile.linuxConfiguration.patchSettings.assessmentMode
| extend VmOS = properties.storageProfile.osDisk.osType
| extend VmState = strcat_array(split(properties.extended.instanceView.powerState.code,"/",1),"")
| extend VM = id
| union (
resources
    | where type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines' and properties.storageProfile.osDisk.osType == 'Windows'
    | extend AutomaticUpdates = properties.osProfile.windowsConfiguration.enableAutomaticUpdates
    | extend PatchMode = properties.osProfile.windowsConfiguration.patchSettings.patchMode
    | extend AssessmentMode = properties.osProfile.windowsConfiguration.patchSettings.assessmentMode
    | extend HotPatching = properties.osProfile.windowsConfiguration.patchSettings.enableHotpatching
    | extend VmOS = properties.storageProfile.osDisk.osType
    | extend VmState = strcat_array(split(properties.extended.instanceView.powerState.code,"/",1),"")
    | extend VM = id
)
| project VM, tostring(VmOS), VmState, tostring(AutomaticUpdates), tostring(PatchMode), tostring(HotPatching), Subscription=strcat("/subscriptions/",subscriptionId)
| summarize count() by VmOS

content.query:
resources
| where type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines' and properties.storageProfile.osDisk.osType == 'Linux'
| extend autoUpdates = properties.osProfile.linuxConfiguration.enableAutomaticUpdates
| extend patchMode = properties.osProfile.linuxConfiguration.patchSettings.patchMode
| extend assessmentMode = properties.osProfile.linuxConfiguration.patchSettings.assessmentMode
| extend vmOS = properties.storageProfile.osDisk.osType
| extend vmState = strcat_array(split(properties.extended.instanceView.powerState.code,"/",1),"")
| extend vmId = tolower(id)
| union (
resources
    | where type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines' and properties.storageProfile.osDisk.osType == 'Windows'
    | extend autoUpdates = properties.osProfile.windowsConfiguration.enableAutomaticUpdates
    | extend patchMode = properties.osProfile.windowsConfiguration.patchSettings.patchMode
    | extend assessmentMode = properties.osProfile.windowsConfiguration.patchSettings.assessmentMode
    | extend hotPatching = properties.osProfile.windowsConfiguration.patchSettings.enableHotpatching
    | extend vmOS = properties.storageProfile.osDisk.osType
    | extend vmState = strcat_array(split(properties.extended.instanceView.powerState.code,"/",1),"")
    | extend vmId = tolower(id)
)
| join kind=leftouter (
    resources
    | extend extensionType = properties.type
    | where type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' and extensionType =~ 'MicrosoftMonitoringAgent' or extensionType =~ 'OMSAgentForLinux'
    | extend vmId = tolower(substring(id, 0, indexof(id, '/extensions')))
    | extend logAnalyticsAgent = "Enabled"
    | extend logAnalyticsAgentWorkspace = properties.settings.workspaceId
    | extend logAnalyticsAgentDetails = properties
    | join kind=leftouter (
        resources
        | extend extensionType = properties.type
        | where type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' and extensionType =~ 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent' or extensionType =~ 'AzureMonitorLinuxAgent'
        | extend vmId = tolower(substring(id, 0, indexof(id, '/extensions')))
        | extend azureMonitorAgent = "Enabled"
        | extend azureMonitorAgentDetails = properties)
    on vmId)
on vmId
| join kind=leftouter (
    patchinstallationresources
    | where type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/patchinstallationresults'
    | extend vmId = tolower(substring(id, 0, indexof(id, '/patchInstallationResults')))
    | extend lastUpdateDate = properties.startDateTime
    | extend lastUpdateReportSource = "ResourceGraph"
    | extend lastUpdateDetails = properties
    | project vmId, tostring(lastUpdateDate), tostring(lastUpdateReportSource), lastUpdateDetails
    | order by tostring(lastUpdateDate) desc
    | summarize arg_max(lastUpdateDate,*) by vmId)
on vmId
| extend vmName = tostring(strcat_array(split(vmId,"/",8),""))
| project vmId=tolower(vmId), vmName, tostring(vmOS), vmState, tostring(autoUpdates), tostring(patchMode), tostring(hotPatching), logAnalyticsAgent, azureMonitorAgent, lastUpdateDate, lastUpdateReportSource, lastUpdateDetails, logAnalyticsAgentDetails, azureMonitorAgentDetails
| order by vmName asc
content.title: Resource Graph Dataset

content.query:
Update
| where ComputerEnvironment == "Azure" and ResourceType == "virtualMachines"
| extend vmId = tolower(ResourceId)
| distinct vmId
| join kind=leftouter (
    Update
    | extend vmId = tolower(ResourceId)
    | where ResourceType == "virtualMachines"
    | summarize arg_max(PublishedDate,*) by vmId
    | project vmId, lastUpdateDate=PublishedDate, computerId=SourceComputerId)
on vmId
| join kind=leftouter (
    Heartbeat
    | where ResourceType == "virtualMachines"
    | extend vmId = tolower(ResourceId)
    | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,*) by vmId
    | project vmId, lastAgentHeartbeat=TimeGenerated,lastAgentHeartbeatType=Category)
on vmId
| extend lastUpdateReportSource = "LogAnalytics"
| project vmId, lastUpdateDate, lastUpdateReportSource, lastAgentHeartbeat, lastAgentHeartbeatType, computerId
| order by tostring(strcat_array(split(vmId,"/",8),"")) asc
content.title: Log Analytics Dataset

content.query:
Update
| where SourceComputerId == '{selected_computerId}'
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by Computer, SourceComputerId, UpdateID
| project updateId=UpdateID, updatePublishDate=PublishedDate, updateState=UpdateState, classification=Classification, updateProduct=Product, updateDetails=Title, kbId=KBID, updateLogDate=TimeGenerated
| order by updatePublishDate desc
content.title: Update Summary (for the selected VM)

content.query:
patchinstallationresources
| where type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/patchinstallationresults'
| extend vmId = tolower(substring(id, 0, indexof(id, '/patchInstallationResults')))
| where vmId == '{selected_vmId}'
| extend dateTime = tostring(properties.startDateTime)
| extend status = tostring(properties.status)
| extend rebootStatus = tostring(properties.rebootStatus)
| extend message = tostring(properties.errorDetails.message)
| extend details = properties
| project vmId, dateTime, status, rebootStatus, message, details
| order by tostring(dateTime) desc
content.title: Platform Update Summary (for the selected VM)

content.json:
## Azure Update Management

**Azure Update Management** use **Azure Automation** and **Log Analytics** to manage operating system updates for your Windows and Linux virtual machines in Azure, physical or VMs in on-premises environments, and in other cloud environments. More details [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/automation/update-management/overview).

content.query:
resources
| where ['type'] == "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions" and name contains "Updates("
| join kind=leftouter (resourcecontainers | where type=="microsoft.resources/subscriptions" | project subscriptionName=name, subscriptionId) on subscriptionId 
| extend workspace = tostring(properties.workspaceResourceId)
| summarize by workspace, tenantId, subscriptionName, subscriptionId

content.query:
Update
| where ComputerEnvironment == "Azure" and ResourceType == "virtualMachines"
| extend vmId = tolower(ResourceId)
| distinct vmId
| join kind=leftouter (
    Update
    | where UpdateState == "Installed" and ComputerEnvironment == "Azure" and ResourceType == "virtualMachines"
    | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,*) by Computer
    | extend vmId = tolower(ResourceId)
    | extend lastUpdateDate = TimeGenerated
    | extend lastUpdateKB = KBID
    | extend lastUpdateType = Classification
    | extend lastUpdateSeverity = MSRCSeverity)
on vmId
| project vmId, lastUpdateDate, lastUpdateKB, lastUpdateType, lastUpdateSeverity
| order by tostring(strcat_array(split(vmId,"/",8),"")) asc

When **Azure Automation Update Management** is enabled, any machine connected to your Updates workspace is by default automatically configured as a **System Hybrid Runbook Worker**. 

> Because the integration of *Azure Resource Manager* and *Custom Endpoint* workbook data sources is limited, you need to browse each **Automation Accounts** individually below to see associated **System Hybrid runbook Worker** underneath (if applied). When Azure Workbook service will permit it, I will implement an automated process to fetch all **System Hybrid Runbook Workers**. Stay tuned!

| project id, location, properties, identity, resourceGroup, subscriptionId, tenantId
